problem_text:
5.5. Fractal domains versus Lipschitz domains
During the last ﬁfty years considerable progress has been made in the study
of elliptic boundary value problems on Lipschitz graph domains (see [27] for a
survey of this development). In particular, classes of solvability and estimates
of solutions received considerable attention in this area.
A Lipschitz graph domain is locally given by
{x = (x′, xn) ∈ R^n,
xn > ϕ(x′)},
where ϕ satisﬁes the Lipschitz condition. Replacing here Lipschitz condition
by H¨older condition, we arrive at the deﬁnition of a H¨older graph domain.
With the existing rich theory of boundary value problems in Lipschitz
graph domains, the absence of similar results in H¨older graph domains seems
ubiquitous.
Problem. Address this issue.
